name: Easy Broccoli-Cheese Casserole
author: thedailygourmet
summary: For the longest time, my mum would make this amazing broccoli casserole. It is more like a crustless quiche, but has converted many broccoli haters into broccoli lovers! I have not ever tweaked this recipe - not even to add minced garlic, sauteed onion, pimento, etc; it's too simple and delicious on its own to need tweaking. This can be made ahead and refrigerated before cooking. It freezes well and can be thawed prior to cooking.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons vegetable oil, or as needed
½ (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Fill a large bowl with ice water to create an ice bath
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add broccoli and cook, uncovered, until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes
Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in the ice bath for several minutes to stop the cooking process
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish with vegetable oil
Combine broccoli, cottage cheese, eggs, Cheddar cheese, butter, flour, salt, and pepper in a large bowl
Spread into the prepared casserole dish
Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 60 to 90 minutes
